Description: Ostracon (?), fragment of the upper-body of a brown pottery ribbed vessel with base of one handle surviving, the fabric is greyish in section, the exterior, now worn, is covered with a self-slip and smudged traces of a black-painted text.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394898) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394898)
